nodes.text: Originally posted by sarablaze Were are all the gun control people with there rebutles. Wow, seems so simple sometimes!:D

I believe they got XXXXXX at all the conservates on this board. So they went and joined a commie discussion board where they feel more welcome and can send congrats to each other for being smarter than regular people.
Default Inference
Originally posted by JFriday You are really going to hurt for that statement. WHERE ARE YOUR STATS BACKING THAT UP?!?!?!  http://www.crimereduction.gov.uk/statistics21.htm . Enjoy!

JFriday: In fairness, no one, pro or ant-gun can ever use UK stats to support thier argument again. Back in Jan '03 the UK government finally came clean and announced that they had been seriously fu**ing with crime statistics. You can make the argument that the UK state had something to hide with guncontrol and you would probably be right. Reliable information from UK ministries should now be accepted as less than credible.
Default Conflict

Originally posted by Patriot Frankly, I don't care if the US statistics were twice as high as they are. The countries you listed, voiceofreason, are, in my opinion, some of the most oppresive nations in existance. Not the most oppressive by far, but they certainly aren't free, even if they are safer.  I'D RATHER BE FREE THAN SAFE. There is a choice. You cannot have both, because a government big enough to give you both is big enough to take both away, to paraphrase Debater's signature quote.

In the Declaration of Independence, Thomas Jefferson identifies the right to life as a fundamental freedom. If more gun-control saves lives then more gun-control means more freedom. Aren't you pro-gunners interested in freedom?
Default Conflict

Originally posted by voiceofreason I do intend to help my community and share the responsibility through non-violent means. I'm not going to go around stabbing and shooting people who I think are criminals. That's not the way to do it. The way to do it is to pass stricter gun-control laws. I'm not going to stand by idly and watch as thousands of people are killed each year with guns in the US. You might be content to bury your head in the sand and pretend everything is rosy, but I believe in getting involved and trying to make a difference. It's called being a concerned citizen.

What is your non-violent way of stopping a felon with a knife? A felon who at 30 has spent 10 years in prison and was raped by other prisoners? I suspect you will do what most New Yorkers will do when they witness a crime: NOT GET INVOLVED! I will stop carrying a pistol when life is rosy. What else do you do to protect yourself besides being concerned?
Default Conflict
Allowing less people to carry concealed handguns means a greater reduction in crime.
Bullsh^t. Permit holders are hundreds of times less likely to commit crimes than YOU, statistically speaking.
Default Conflict
Your personal safety is your own responsibility. There is no community responsibility owed to you.

Then why do the police and the FBI exist? How about neighborhood watch programs? According to your logic these programs and organizations should all be abolished. Safety is a personal as well as a community responsibility.
Default Conflict
I'm not going to go around stabbing and shooting people who I think are criminals. That's not the way to do it.
Even when they're trying to stab or shoot you?
Default Inference
The way to do it is to pass stricter gun-control laws.
And what're you going to do when a criminal says 'F**k you and your gun control, it's not gonna keep me from getting a gun if I want one'?
Default Conflict
I do intend to help my community and share the responsibility through non-violent means.
Non-violence is a non-answer.
Default Conflict
